description:
average ratio of the duration of energization to the total period in which intermittent or continuous or temporary duty takes place.
1  The duty factor may be expressed as a percentage of the total period. 

2 The factor varies between 0 and 100 %.
 100 % indicates that the component  is continuously in operation.
 50 % indicates that the component is, within a given period, half of that period  intermitting in operation.

3  The value of the factor  is normally specified by the user in charge of the process.
replaces AAF436 simultaneity factor.
